general_ai_community: Claude Opus 4.6 model launch (2.1.32) — new frontier model available in Claude Code
Agent Teams research preview (2.1.32) — multi-agent collaboration, requires CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1
Automatic memory system (2.1.32) — Claude records and recalls memories across sessions
Fast mode for Opus 4.6 (2.1.36) — same model, faster output, toggle with /fast
Permission resolution improved — content-level ask now overrides tool-level allow (security fix)
PR session linking — sessions auto-link to PRs via gh pr create, --from-pr flag added
Sandbox bypass vulnerability fixed (2.1.34) — excludedCommands could bypass Bash ask rule
specific_workflows: Subagent MCP fix (2.1.30) — Task-spawned agents now receive SDK-provided MCP tools
Task tool metrics (2.1.30) — token count, tool uses, duration now reported back to orchestrator
Agent memory frontmatter (2.1.33) — agents can declare persistent memory with user/project/local scope
Task(agent_type) restriction (2.1.33) — agent tools frontmatter can restrict spawnable sub-agents
TeammateIdle and TaskCompleted hook events (2.1.33) — for multi-agent workflows
PDF pages parameter (2.1.30) — Read tool accepts pages: 1-5 for targeted reading
Prompt cache fix (2.1.30) — cache invalidates on schema changes, not just tool name changes
Heredoc template literal fix (2.1.32) — no more Bad substitution for ${...} in bash heredocs
Session resume memory usage reduced 68% (2.1.30) — stat-based loading
Skill character budget scales with context window (2.1.32) — 2% of context
Use --from-pr to resume work on existing PRs — matches orchestrator workflow well
CLI remains most stable interface — ripgrep timeout errors now reported instead of silent empty results
